articles.title: US Domestic News: Top Headlines and Legal Battles
articles.description: The U.S. sees a delay in a trial for a suspect in a Trump assassination attempt, Ford and GM's inauguration donations, Rocket Homes accused of illegal kickbacks, and Bill Clinton's hospitalization. Other highlights include a subway murder charge, Biden's commutations, and legal issues surrounding NYC Mayor Adams and Congressman Matt Gaetz.
articles.content: The U.S. federal court has moved the trial of Ryan Routh, the suspect involved in an attempt on President-elect Donald Trump's life, to September 2025 due to extensive evidence, according to Monday's court order. Originally scheduled for February 10,... [820 chars]

articles.title: Trial Delay in Trump's Second Assassination Attempt Case
articles.description: A trial for Ryan Routh, accused of attempting to assassinate President-elect Donald Trump, has been postponed to September 2025. The delay was granted by Judge Aileen Cannon due to the extensive evidence involved. Routh faces five federal charges, having pleaded not guilty.

articles.title: Biden's Bold Clemency Move: Halting Federal Executions
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden commuted the sentences of 37 federal inmates on death row, converting them to life imprisonment. This decision came before President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration, aiming to frustrate Trump's execution agenda. Biden's clemency move aligns with his anti-death penalty stance despite facing significant criticism.
